definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view

sentences.english: Never gloat over the ruin of your friend.
sentences.chinese: 不要冷眼旁觀看着你的朋友墮落。

sentences.english: He gave me the cold shoulder at the party.
sentences.chinese: 他在聚會上對我冷眼相待。

sentences.english: Only after his death to be cold-shouldered look at themselves and friends under the mask of real life.
sentences.chinese: 死後才得以冷眼審視自己和朋友們面具下的真實生活。

sentences.english: Secular ruined, though I will look on coldly.
sentences.chinese: 世俗的荒涼，我卻冷眼旁觀。

sentences.english: Cast a cold eye , on life , on death.
You could learn from it that I was growing up in others’ discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 可以這麼說，童年的我是在別人的冷眼中長大的。

sentences.english: Cast a cold Eye on Life, on Death.
The pace of change is rapid, and you can't sit on the sidelines.
sentences.chinese: 改變的速度飛快，而你不能冷眼旁觀。

sentences.english: We got a cold shoulder from the older members of the club.
sentences.chinese: 我們受到俱樂部老會員們的冷眼相待。

sentences.english: Cast a cold eye , on life, on death.
Such petty-bourgeois individualists always look coldly from the side-lines at the people's cause.
sentences.chinese: 主義者對人民的事業總是抱着冷眼旁觀的態度。

definition: the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to turn a blind eye to
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect
